structure.unit: PHYSICIANS, OSTEOPATHS, PODIATRISTS, AND RELATED MEDICAL PRACTITIONERS

law.text: A physician may prescribe or administer amygdalin (laetrile) in lieu of or in addition to customary or accepted modes of therapy in the treatment of any malignancy, disease, illness or physical condition of a patient who has signed a written informed request and who has been determined by the physician to be terminally ill.
law.history: Created 1980 Ky. Acts ch. 354, sec. 4, effective July 15, 1980.
